title: EastEnders spoilers: Shocking scenes as Martin launches brutal attack
text:
Martin Fowler (James Bye) has found himself at the beck-and-call of Ben Mitchell (Max Bowden) since returning to Walford in EastEnders and, tonight, his anger got the better of him during a pick-up job, as he released his pent up aggression when two men arrived and got in his way as he was collecting money.

Martin was delighted when Ben handed over the wrench which Stacey (Lacey Turner) used to clobber Phil (Steve McFadden), as he believed his troubles were finally at an end. However, little did he know that Tubbs (Tayla Kovacevic-Ebong) had filmed him illegally acquiring a car for Kheerat (Jaz Deol) — something which Ben has been using as leverage into order to get Martin to do his dirty work.

In Tuesday’s episode, viewers saw Martin head off on his first pick-up on Ben’s behalf, but when he realised that the elderly woman was unable to pay up, Martin decided to used the takings from the stall to in order to pay off her debt — and Ben remained none-the-wiser.

However, in tonight’s episode, Ian (Adam Woodyatt) proceeded to asked Martin for Monday’s takings — and it didn’t long for the truth to come to light, as Ben figured out what Martin had done. Fuming, he berated Martin for not carrying out the task required of him, and told him he needs to toughen up.

If that wasn’t bad enough, Martin later found out that his services were required for yet another pick-up and that this time, Tubbs would be accompanying him. It’s safe to say that this one didn’t exactly go as planned either, as — during said pick-up — two men arrived and got in his way. With his rage building, Martin violently punched the pair of them.

However, he didn’t stop at just one punch, as he proceeded to punch the guy repeatedly, before storming off down the market — rage and emotion apparent in his eyes.

It’s safe to assume that working with Ben is certainly taking its toll on Martin — but will there be repercussions for his actions?

Ben did tell him to toughen up, so perhaps he’ll be chuffed with Martin’s angrier approach? Tubbs’ positive reaction to Martin’s mean streak would certainly seem to indicate that this will be the case.

What’s more, how’s Martin going to explain his injuries to Sonia (Natalie Cassidy) or Bex?

EastEnders continues on Friday 18th October at 8:30pm on BBC One.
